title: Markov Blankets and Free Energy Principle : From Oar to Winnowing Fan, Rescuing Treasure from Chaos.
description:
Correction:
1:26:30 to 1:26:40:  Lethe is forgetting and alethea is remembering in this context.
Karl Friston video on Markov Blankets:  
Notes from the discussion:
Expression of a thing - that is something rather than nothing.
A balance manifesting between the external states and the internal states.
A reconciliation in each discrete moment of time
The boundary state is a Markov blanket. Context?
The universe - as it began to expand, it also began to reconcile.
The one becoming the many and the many becoming the one.
Life is anti-entropic, differentiating itself from its environment.
A drop of oil - it has a "muchness" against dispersion to minimize free energy.
Thoughts on Odysseus gathered from Lewis Hyde's collected vignettes from classical mythology. Note: words, letters, stories, also have Markov blankets.
He was trying to make his way home but Poseidon was preventing him. Told him that in order to get home, he must continue until he found a people who would find a different use for his oar. The oar represents both the physical and the imaginal. In the borderland, meaning dissolves.
Jung, holding the tension of opposites, something novel emerges - an image of reconciliation.
Ideas are seeking to minimize the free energy state, to fight it out or find a reconciliation. 

The ark as a container - it gets to see the reconciled image. That which reconciles survives.
The nature of meaning. In the sense of "the world as a place of objects", the oar is an idol to the god Poseidon and the winnowing fan is an idol to the god of the harvest. In the sense of "the world as a forum for action", the transformation of the oar to winnowing fan represents a portal of transformation, a dissolution and resolution, the creative act of the hero finding the treasure in the chaos and bringing it home to revivify stagnant order.
